answers.answer: Yes! I'm 13 weeks and went to the store today. What usually takes me an hour, took me over 2 hours! With it being so hot, I lose energy fast. I've been wanting to exercise too. Just driving my 10 year old to school is exhausting. I don't remember being this tired with my first one.

Yes I'm 21 wks. Feel same exact way. I do have an 11 yo. 7 yo and almost 1 yo. I feel like passing out alot. Told my dr. He had me get the glucose test down now, rather than later.  I failed the 1 hr. Then took 3 hr one.  Came back Gestational diabetes.  I also had other symptoms like heart racing, sweats n stuff.  Nvr had it any other preg. So maybe tell ur Dr ur symptoms?

I am 9 weeks and I can sleep for 12 hours at a time. I am EXHAUSTEDmost of the day. My prenatal vitamins don't help with energy. I've been told to eat clean, but even that doesn't help with the fatigue. We're definitely in the same boat. I have no desire to clean or workout.
Im glad im not the only one thanks everyone :-) I will consult my doc about the glucose test I havent had it done.

And try to force yourself to wake up earlier I had the same issues and my nutritionist friend said force yourself up and the first week it was rough im not gonna lie second week about half and half bow im feeling much better I still more times then not need a 1 or two hour nap no more then that. Hopefully not diabetes and just yoyr sleep cycle is mostly off. I was experiencing light handedness then as well and force myself to drink more water along with thesleep and much better

question: 21 wks and I just feel so drained all the time. I just want to sleep. When I do manage to get out of bed and go out with the family I get tired so quick I didnt think that was normal also the fact that I feel like I'm going to pass out as well. So I thought maybe it's because im out of shape and have no exercise in my daily routines. But how can I do that when I have no energy?  Any one else feel like this. Its starting to be so overwhelming.  :-(
title: Fatigue
